item.title: Cisco Steps In Front Of The Video Parade
item.description: John Naisbitt, a renowned futurist, once said that true leadership involves recognizing a trend and positioning oneself at its forefront. Cisco seems to have taken this to heart by acquiring Flip Video, the company behind the wildly popular camcorder line. It appears Cisco sees consumer-generated video as a growing trend and intends to lead the charge. But what exactly are their plans? To understand Cisco’s strategy, it’s crucial to examine the Flip video camera’s impact on the camcorder market.

item.title: HTC Aria Social Networking Smartphone
item.description: If you’re looking for a way to stay connected, forget dogs â€“ get FriendStream! This service lets you interact with friends through Facebook, Twitter, and Flickr, all from the HTC Aria, a cutting-edge Android smartphone. The Aria boasts a sleek, seamless design crafted from a single piece of black aluminum. It’s compact enough for your pocket yet powerful enough for work and play. Its sizable 3.2-inch touchscreen features pinch-to-zoom functionality, automatically adjusting text size for comfortable website browsing.
